headline: Baked Denver Omelet
description: This baked Denver omelet is really a frittata with ham, bell pepper, onion, and Cheddar cheese -- all the classic ingredients of the original.

video.description: Like a frittata, with ham, bell pepper, onions, and Cheddar cheese.
video.name: Baked Denver Omelet

name: Baked Denver Omelet
recipeIngredient: salt and ground black pepper to taste

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Grease a 10-inch round baking dish.
Melt butter in a large skillet over medium heat; cook and stir onion and bell pepper until softened, about 5 minutes. Stir in ham and continue cooking until heated through, 5 minutes more.
Beat eggs and milk in a large bowl. Stir in Cheddar cheese and ham mixture; season with salt and black pepper. Pour mixture into prepared baking dish.
Bake in preheated oven until eggs are browned and puffy, about 25 minutes. Serve warm.

review.reviewBody: So easy! Feeds 4 adults easy!!! Delish
It was really easy to make, and delicious! You can add or change the basic ingredients to your liking!

Made this for Father’s Day brunch & it was a hit! I sautéed the ingredients too. For more protein and fluff, I added a cup of small curd cottage cheese. A little extra protein and keto friendly. I will definitely be making this again & again! Yum!
I added a little more cheese and used Canadian Bacon instead.

Very tasty and easy recipe. I have a concern with the nutrition information accuracy. I ran the ingredients through an app designed to estimate the calorie content of a recipe and determined that the recipe as written is off by more than 100 calories per serving despite using reduce fat cheddar and 1% milk instead of whole. It is probably off by more if made as written. 
These numbers should not vary by this much. It got me questioning AllRecipes methods on nutrition values
Perfect as written. Tasted grest and was sooooooo easy. I agree with others, if you make your own concoction and it does turn out right, dont low rate the recipe YOU chose not to follow!
Loved it
This is my go to egg dish I can make as is, add more ingredients based on what everyone likes.
Perfect the way it was written. I made it for brunch, had to double it to feed the whole family. Everyone loved it and it was easy to make.

Fantastic recipe. For the first time I made it exactly as written - and it came out perfect! I've had a hard time getting things like this to come out cooked enough, without being dry. The measurements for everything were spot on, and it came out perfect! Lightly browned, fully cooked, yet not dry. We plan on using this as the base for all future types of omelets. Just perfect!
Excellent dish! I made just as directed except I subbed 3/4 cp bacon + 1/4 potato for the ham, and used shredded provolone/mozz instead of cheddar. Cooked just as directed, came out beautifully!

Very good. Was looking for a low carb - no sugar breakfast for our Sunday morning get togethers to meet everyone's dietary needs. While at church Mom pops this into the oven and is done when we return. Multiple thumbs up.

I’m really not a fan of omelettes but decided to give this a try. I substituted ham for Jimmy Dean sausage patties, about 6. Baked it in a 10 inch pie pan. It turned out delicious. Husband loved it too. Oh I also sprinkled some extra cheddar cheese on top with 5 minutes left.

This was great. It was simple enough to make without doing too much in the morning. My family is vegetarian, so I used 4 beyond breakfast sausages, which was 1 cup of sausage after cooking and dicing. Other than that, I used cream because it was what I had on hand and followed the recipe from there. Will definitely make again.
Really good. The only change I made was to lower my oven temperature slightly as it runs hot.
Favorite go to dish!

This has all the flavor of a Denver Omelet and a lot easier to make. This is especially true if you are feeding more than 1 or 2 people because you don't have to worry about your first omelet getting cold while you are making the others. 

One thing to note, I made this is an oven safe skillet. This cuts down on dishes as you need to sauté the vegetables first anyway. Also, this will puff up when you make it so give yourself room in the pan.
excellent!!! I had leftover ham from Christmas it was delicious. what a perfect, light recipe for breakfast or dinner. thank you
This is a weekend breakfast must have. I add minced garlic and bacon bits to my onion and pepper mixture. Lastly I add sprinkled cheese to top after removing from oven.
I used bacon instead of ham, added few extra ingredients I had in the refrigerator. I may have over baked it, but it was good. I also baked it in an iron skillet. Turned out really good.

This was a big hit! I always make 4+ different casseroles for our family's Christmas brunch gathering. I always try at least one new recipe. This will definitely be on future menus. It was simple to make ahead, serve, and delicious!

I made without the onion and pepper. Added a few handfuls of fresh spinach. This was amazing!!! Better then an omelette and less calories than a quiche! Both my kids and husband loved it and asked me to make another. Saving this for years to come! Thanks.
I make this at least 3 times a month. It is easy and Delicious, I sometimes add a little swiss cheese as well.

Great addition to Christmas morning breakfast! Made 2 in 8 x 8 Pyrex, one with sausage and one without. Easy to make and received rave reviews from the family. Baked side by side in 35 minutes. Will use again soon.
I've made this a few times; easy to substitute different veggies for what I have on hand. DH said to put it on the list!

Crowd pleaser!! Would be perfect for a large holiday brunch. Change ingredients to your liking and lay out 4 or 5 of these babies at large family gathering/brunch. Much better than cracking and scrambling 36-48 eggs like we have done for the past 20 years!
Delicious! I used unsweetened vanilla almond milk instead of regular.
This was a wonderful breakfast!!!! I made mine in a 9” pie plate and had left over for muffin tins too! Wonderful breakfast!
Just fixed it for the third time. Has become family favorite. Only change is sweet peppers instead of green.

Just made this for the first time, and easily giving it five stars . I like to tinker with recipes, but not the first time around, and usually keep notes for modifications on future attempts. This was no attempt; but instead one of those rare finds that you can nail the first time around. I will try substituting Trader Joe’s Everyday Seasoning for the salt and pepper, next time around, but simply since it is a household preference. We will definitely be making this again!

Husband liked it (I don't eat eggs)...but it needs more than 1/2 cup of cheddar! I also added some chopped mushrooms. It took an extra 10 minutes to cook throughout for a total of 35 minutes. I will make it again with more cheese next time! Thanks for sharing!

I needed another breakfast recipe to break the monotony and was happy to have found this recipe. I followed the recipe for the most part and only added more cheese so instead of 1/2 c I did 3/4-1c of cheese which made it cheesier and moist. It was pretty good and my picky husband liked it.
So yummy and filling! This was a hit with my husband!
I made this recipe this morning and it is great. I did add a little garlic salt, garlic powder and onion powder to spice it up. Great recipe!
This turned out so good! I had to add about 5-10 minutes to the baking time, and I decreased the onion and added more cheese to our tastes. We loved it!

I followed the recipe exactly. I used a iron skillet and followed the timing.
I will mark this as a favorite.

I made this recipe exactly as printed. I don’t think it’s fair to review a recipe that you’ve made changes to. It came out perfect! It was easy to follow and very tasty. My husband said it was restaurant worthy. I will definitely make again.
Super easy and very delicious!! A great recipe to play around with too!
Made one with the ham recipe and another with leftover chicken sausage. Both yum!

This was amazing. By itself with out all of the add ones it would be a four. With my substitutes though it was a five. I sautéed the onion and some turkey meat in a pan. Then added 6 eggs and one half of a cup of cottage cheese whisked together. I also added leftover beans from fajitas some chives lawrys salt and pepper. Then baked in cupcake pan for individual breakfast at 400 for twenty minutes. Was heaven on a plate. I got 14 servings from that.
delicious!
I had never made an omelet before in my life and it still turned out phenomenal with this recipe.
I made this just as the recipe states but added a few red pepper flakes when sautéing the onion and pepper. But I do that in almost all my cooking. Loved it!
Good recipe! I used cooked bacon and added banana peppers. Easy to adapt with preferences.
I made the recipe it was very simple I love the ingredients I did omit the onions because my children don’t like them
I made this for a low carb meal . It was very easy and very good,
Great basic recipe. Next time I’ll experiment with different meats and veggies. I cut in half because there are only two of us and we still had leftovers.
Great with salsa

I have made this for years and it is so good! You don't really need to saute the onions and bell peppers though. I just put them directly in with the rest of the ingredients and they still cook. Doing this also eliminates the need for the butter. I usually don't measure the ham, cheese, bell pepper or onion, I just put in what I have (and I must confess that I add much more than the recipe calls for). I usually use a full dozen eggs and just slightly more milk (my recipe calls for half and half, but I usually use milk...heavy whipping cream works well also). I usually have to bake it a little longer than the recipe says, but you can easily tell when it's done. The great thing about this recipe is that it is equally good reheated, and can even be eaten cold. It's definitely a keeper. Everyone I know who has ever tried it has loved it. Even those who don't really care for bell peppers and onions. I like to put those in a food chopper and chop them up really fine. It tends to give the final dish a greenish color, but it is really good.

Like another reviewer, since you are baking it you can soften up your onions, green pepper and ham in the microwave in a small bowl with a little butter for about 1 min. If onions spark you can lower the power to 7 and add a little more time.
Delicious!

This was a hit at my house! I used bacon and ham together, I fried the vegetables in bacon grease instead of butter, and used a oven-proof frying pan so I didn't need to dirty any more dishes than necessary. It was amazing, I will make this again and try different ingredients, ie taco meat and other good things.
Great recipe. I had to adjust the recipe for two people. Used a cast iron skillet that worked fine.
Eggcellent!! and easy, just as it’s written!
So easy with items we usually have on hand. I chopped up some of our honey baked sandwich meat instead of thicker ham. Reheats well in the microwave. Easy make ahead dish.

My husband and I don't eat ham so I altered this and used asparagus, mushrooms, red and orange pepper, a little fresh spinach and feta cheese (only 3/4 cup) . Really good. I'll be making it again. Super with a side of rosemary red potatoes.
The whole family loved it! Will definitely make it again
this casserole is really good. It is so easy to make and freezes well.
No changes so much easier than making individual omelets. We will make again!

I made a few modifications: 3 finely chopped shallots instead of onion, and added some garlic and dried Italian seasoning blend to the frying pan. I also baked it in a square baking dish because can you believe I don’t own a circular cake pan?! Came out AWESOME. I would make this again in a heartbeat!
Made only half the recipe and it was great. Made it exactly as written.
This recipe was easy and delicious. I followed instructions just as it was written. Yes I could have made changes but I didn’t. This recipe is perfect the way it is!!
very easy would add more ham, peppers and perhaps more spices next time. It was good but not exceptional
Used sausage and green onions, it came out perfect, so easy and yummy. Great recipe for a brunch or cooking for a crowd.
Accidentally reviewed before with 4 stars and I definitely meant 5!!!
I made it from original recipe and it turned out very good.
This recipe turned out great. I added asparagus, a little american cheese and Boursin cheese as well. I also made two smaller individual size portions, but cooked them for less time.
Outstanding and versatile.
Wonderful and so quick for dinner or breakfast
Wonderful and so quick for dinner or breakfast
I halved the recipe and used a 9" skillet to sautee the veggies and bake. It was delicious! Served 2 and is now my new omelet making technique.

This is a very versatile recipe. We used sausage instead of the ham. You can use really any protein and I think it would be GREAT! I could have left it in for 20 min and I think it would have been perfect (but that's my oven). Will definitely make this again! Thank you so much for posting!

I make this kind of thing a lot. I call it a Frittata. You can put almost any vegetables or meat in it. What is quicker is to cook it on top of the stove (I use a cast iron skillet, well seasoned) and cook the bottom to about 3/4 thru and then put it under the broiler to finish cooking the top. Its really easy and yummy.
I made mine with a Mexican flare and used Chorizo and Jalapeños, turned out to be really good!
Used bacon instead if ham ! Added some green onion too! Quick to make . Awesome !

Delicious! I made this exactly as the recipe directed except that I followed another reviewer's recommendation to cook the ham and onions in the baking pan with melted butter as I prepared the eggs. The omelet is very tasty and I'm sure to make it many more times as a quick supper or lazy day brunch.
I sauteed the onions and sweet peppers in alot of butter after the oven preheated as well added small cuts of Colby Jack cheese.
I added chopped tomatoes to the ingredients and baked it in my Ninja Foodi Grill on the bake setting at 375 for 18 minutes. Delicious!!!
Made half the recipe. Took 15 minutes in the oven. Didn’t have ham so I used chorizo. Great flavor. Easy recipe.

Delicious and easy to make. I used 6 eggs, (and the same amount suggested for everything else), almond milk, didn't have have ham but used red and green bell peppers, along with everything else. Wish I had thought of spinach and mushrooms but that will be next time. I followed the instructions for cooking and it was perfect. I wish I had taken a picture, it was beautiful.
I have been baking this exact same recipe for years. It is easy and delicious.
I enjoyed the recipe, and the family said, please, please make this again soooooon
Boring. Could could make this while sleeping. and it would be better..Where are the spices?
Followed the recipe, as it was the first time I made this. Definitely a do-over. Next time I will substitute sour cream or crema for the milk. Seriously thinking about a cheese steak variant.
It was very good. I didn't saute the vegetables in butter I just put it all together and baked it. Next time I will add minced garlic.
Not really an omelet. More of a frittata. Different textures.
Excellent, light, fluffy, and crisp. My family wants this again. If you are a low-salt person, the salt in the ham is plenty enough for this recipe. And there is plenty of cheese.

Eggcellent! Used 1 skillet, sautéed onion, spinach, mushrooms, onion in oven, then added egg mixture w heavy whipping cream, salt pepper, Colby jack cheese, baby Swiss...back in the oven, let eggs set up then topped w more cheeses, Roma tomato slices and basil. Soooo easy, delish!
I made this for Easter- it was super easy and delicious! It was surprisingly good leftover the next day too! Crowd pleaser for sure
This was easy to make and tasted great. I followed the recipe exactly as written. Will definitely make again!
This is a great meal for breakfast or dinner.
I really enjoyed this recipe. Easy to make and tasted great! I had it with buttered toast and bacon. Next time, I might add more cheese and salt.
Made this exactly as written, so delicious! Thanks for the recipe!!
Delicious! This recipe has endless possibilities!
Love this recipe for an easy dinner!
Delicious. This was a huge hit in my house!

Made as written with the addition of 2 cups of leftover steamed broccoli and 1 cup of shredded cheese instead of 1/2 cup because we love our cheese! Can't get any simpler then this for a week night meal.

Used up some leftover ham on this, and it wasn’t terribly different from other recipes I’ve used...but nevertheless, everyone really enjoyed it! I added a little garlic powder to it and added some additional cheese on top in the last minutes of cooking, but otherwise I followed the recipe.
I was looking for a breakfast recipe I can make on a Sunday evening to portion out for breakfasts I can take to work with me. This was super easy to make and tasted great reheat.
